title_sort: louisa van velsor whitman to walt whitman, 27 february [1873]
title: Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, 27 February [1873]
text: Camden Feb. 1873febuaryFebruary 27 My dear waltWalti have been waiting till this thursdayThursday afternoon thinking i should hear from Jeffy but i have not had a word from him since poor mattiesMattie's death i sent two letters to him after mattyMattys death and Lou sent one to the children poor little girls i wish i had a home to take them for a while any how i expect jeffJeff is in much trouble poor Jeff i had a letter from han to day a very good one i will send it to jeffyJeffy it speaks so good of mattyMatty i got your letter waltWalt to day you seem to have kind friends i hope dear waltWalt you will have a home of your own some day if ever we want a home it is when we are sick i have wanted to hear from jeffyJeffy and the children so bad itsit's so strange i wrote to him to ask him if he wouldentwouldn't come on here and go to see you i thought maybeemaybe it would make him feel better i wish he would come you cantcan't write as you can talk to any one i beleivebelieve i haventhaven't much more to write dear waltWalt i want to see you and hope you can be well enoughfenough to come beforbefore long georgeGeorge and Lou are well georgeGeorge has bought a lot on the corner where he spoke of when you was here) O waltWalt how i doodo want you to get wellgood bie dear waltWalt Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, 27 February [1873]
